whatIsFormshive.title: What is Formshive?
whatIsFormshive.subtitle: Learn the basics of Formshive
whatIsFormshive.description: Formshive is a simple tool that helps you create web forms and collect submissions from your website visitors. Think of it like a digital mailbox - people fill out your forms, and you receive their messages.

keyBenefits.title: Key Benefits
keyBenefits.noCoding: No coding required for basic forms
keyBenefits.multipleWays: Multiple ways to integrate with your website

formsWithWithoutFields.title: Forms With & Without Fields
formsWithWithoutFields.subtitle: Understanding how Formshive handles different types of forms

withFields.title: Forms WITH Fields (Structured)
withFields.description: When you define specific fields (like "Name", "Email", "Message"), Formshive knows exactly what to expect. This gives you more features like validation, required fields, and prettier form layouts.

withoutFields.title: Forms WITHOUT Fields (Flexible)
withoutFields.description: You can also create a form that accepts ANY content - whatever someone sends, you'll receive. This is perfect for simple contact forms or when you want maximum flexibility.

formSubmission.title: Form Submission
formSubmission.subtitle: How form submissions work and what happens after users submit
formSubmission.description: When someone submits your form, Formshive processes the data through several validation steps and then responds based on your form configuration and the type of request.

validation.title: Validation Process
validation.description: Every form submission goes through comprehensive validation to ensure data quality and security. If validation fails, users receive detailed error messages.

formExists.label: Form exists
formExists.description: Verifies the form ID is valid

fieldValidation.label: Field validation
fieldValidation.description: Checks required fields, email format, etc. (if enabled)

spamDetection.label: Spam detection
spamDetection.description: Analyzes content for spam patterns (if enabled)

errorHandling.title: User-Friendly Error Handling
errorHandling.description: When someone makes a mistake filling out your form, Formshive provides helpful, clear error messages. Instead of losing their work, users see exactly what needs to be fixed, with their original input preserved.

htmlForms.title: HTML Forms (Website Visitors):
htmlForms.seeErrorPage: See a friendly error page with the form
htmlForms.inputPreserved: Their input is preserved - no retyping!
htmlForms.fieldErrors: Specific field errors highlighted in red
htmlForms.clearExplanation: Clear explanation of what went wrong

apiRequests.title: API/JSON Requests (Developers):
apiRequests.detailedError: Detailed error information in JSON format
apiRequests.perfectForDynamic: Perfect for dynamic forms and apps

afterSubmission.title: What Happens After Someone Submits Your Form
afterSubmission.description: When someone successfully submits your form, Formshive decides what to show them next. This depends on how your form is set up and how it's being used on your website.
afterSubmission.diagramNote: If you prefer to see a diagram:

customThankYou.title: Custom Thank You Page:
customThankYou.description: If you set a "Redirect URL" in your form settings, visitors go directly to your custom thank you page. Perfect for special offers or detailed next steps.

builtInSuccess.title: Built-in Success Page:
builtInSuccess.description: If no redirect URL is set, visitors see a simple "Thank you, your message was received" page. Clean and professional, works great for most forms.

forDevelopers.title: For Developers (API):
forDevelopers.description: JavaScript/AJAX requests get JSON responses instead of page redirects. Perfect for dynamic forms that don't reload the page.

overrideOptions.title: Advanced: Override Options
overrideOptions.description: You can add special parameters to your form URL to control what happens:

redirectHtml.description: Always show the built-in success page

redirectNone.description: For developers: return JSON instead of redirecting

integrationExamples.title: Integration Examples
integrationExamples.description: Here are examples of how different integration methods handle form submissions:

javascript.title: JavaScript (AJAX):
javascript.error: ❌ Error: Gets detailed error JSON for custom handling

htmlForm.title: HTML Form:
htmlForm.code:
<form action="/v1/digest/form-id" 
      method="POST">
  <input name="email" type="email">
  <input name="message">
  <button type="submit">Send</button>
</form>
htmlForm.success: ✅ Success: Redirects to thank you page or custom URL
htmlForm.error: ❌ Error: Shows user-friendly error page with form

proTips.title: Pro Tips for Better User Experience

setRedirect.description: to send visitors to a custom thank-you page with next steps

testForms.description: by filling them out incorrectly to see the error experience

helpfulErrors.description: users appreciate clear guidance on how to fix problems

monitor.description: in the Messages tab to spot patterns or common user issues

integrationMethods.title: Integration Methods
integrationMethods.subtitle: Different ways to add forms to your website
integrationMethods.description: Formshive offers several ways to integrate forms into your website, from simple copy-paste solutions to advanced customization.

manual.title: Manual HTML
manual.description: Write your own HTML form and point it to Formshive. Perfect if you're comfortable with HTML or have an existing form.

success.description: Follows redirect behavior from "Form Submission" - custom URL redirect or built-in success page.

validation.description: Only for forms WITH defined fields (see "Forms With & Without Fields") - shows user-friendly error page with preserved input and highlighted field errors.

javascript.title: JavaScript Embed
javascript.description: Add a small script to your website and Formshive creates the form automatically. Works great with defined fields.

success.description: With redirect URL - redirects page. Without redirect URL - shows inline success message and clears form.

validation.description: For forms WITH defined fields - highlights specific field errors directly in the form with red styling and error messages. Much more user-friendly than page reloads!

iframe.title: IFrame
iframe.description: Embed a complete form as a frame on your page. Easy to add, works everywhere, with different styling options.

success.description: Shows built-in success page within the iframe. Users stay on your website.

validation.description: For forms WITH defined fields - shows error page within iframe with preserved input and field highlighting. Users stay on your site while fixing errors.

directLink.title: Direct Link
directLink.description: Share a direct link to your form. Great for emails, social media, or when you want a standalone form page.

success.description: Full-page experience - follows your form's redirect settings from "Form Submission" (custom URL or success page).

validation.description: For forms WITH defined fields - shows full-page error experience with preserved input and field highlighting. Users can easily fix and resubmit.

beginners.description: Start with IFrame or Direct Link - they're the easiest!

existingForms.description: Use Manual HTML to keep your current design

advancedUsers.description: JavaScript Embed gives you the most flexibility

emailSetup.title: Email Recipients
emailSetup.subtitle: Getting notified when someone submits your form
emailSetup.description: When someone fills out your form, Formshive can send you an email notification. You can add multiple email addresses to receive these notifications.

verification.title: Email Verification Required
verification.description: For security, you'll need to verify your email address before you can receive form submissions. This prevents spam and ensures you actually own the email address.

addEmail.description: Enter the email address where you want to receive notifications

checkInbox.description: Look for a verification email from Formshive

clickVerify.description: Click the verification link in the email

multipleRecipients.title: Multiple Recipients
multipleRecipients.description: You can add multiple verified email addresses to a single form. This is great for teams where multiple people need to see form submissions.

captchaSetup.title: CAPTCHA Setup
captchaSetup.subtitle: Protect your forms from spam and bots
captchaSetup.description: CAPTCHA is like a security guard for your forms. It helps block spam messages and ensures that real people are filling out your forms, not automated bots.

howItWorks.title: How CAPTCHA Works
howItWorks.description: When someone tries to submit your form, they'll need to solve a simple math problem. This takes just a few seconds for humans but stops most spam bots completely.

enable.description: Go to your form settings and turn on "Check Challenge"

updateWebsite.description: Your website needs a small script to show the CAPTCHA

test.description: Try submitting your form to make sure it works

free.description: No extra charges for blocked spam

technicalHelp.title: Need Technical Help?
technicalHelp.description: For detailed setup instructions and code examples, check the Integration tab when editing your form. It has all the technical details and copy-paste code you need.

fieldConfiguration.title: Field Configuration
fieldConfiguration.subtitle: Customizing your form fields
fieldConfiguration.description: When you create forms with defined fields, you can customize each field to behave exactly how you want.

proTip.title: Pro Tip
proTip.description: Start simple with just a few fields like Name, Email, and Message. You can always add more fields later as your needs grow!

tomlConfiguration.title: Programmatic Field Configuration (TOML)
tomlConfiguration.subtitle: Advanced form configuration using code

advancedOnly.title: For Advanced Users Only
advancedOnly.description: This section is for developers and advanced users who prefer to configure forms using code. If you're comfortable with the visual form builder, you can skip this section entirely.

tomlConfiguration.description: Instead of using the visual form builder, you can define your form fields using TOML configuration. This gives you more precise control and makes it easier to version control your form specifications. TOML (Tom's Obvious, Minimal Language) is a simple configuration format that lets you define form fields, validation rules, and behavior using structured text instead of clicking through menus.

basicExample.title: Basic Example:
basicExample.code:
[field]
name = "email"
field = "email"
label = "Your Email"
placeholder = "Enter your email address"
required = true
is_email = true

[field]
name = "message"
field = "textarea"
label = "Message"
placeholder = "Tell us what you think"
required = true
is_min = 10

versionControl.description: Track changes to your forms over time

teamCollaboration.description: Share form specs without account access

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: To use TOML configuration, go to your form's Form Fields (Optional) section and paste your TOML specification into the text area. The system will validate your configuration and show any errors that need to be fixed.
